p: The ability of S. africana EO to inhibit soybean lipoxygenase was determined as an indication of potential anti-inflammatory activity. S. africana EO exhibited an inhibition of LOX activity ( Table 2). The percentage of inhibition increases with the concentration of S. africana EO, i.e., 23.4% at 0.015 mg/mL to 57.6% at 0.075 mg/mL of EO. No LOX activity could be detected in the presence of 0.1 mg/mL of S. africana EO, suggesting almost complete inhibition of LOX activity. The IC 50 values (concentration at which 50% of the lipoxygenase was inhibited) were determined for the S. africana EO and for the non-competitive inhibitor of lipoxygenase, the nordihydroguaiaretic acid (NDGA) ( Table 2), usually used as reference in anti-inflammatory assays [ 38, 39, 40]. Data showed that the IC 50 value of S. africana essential oil (0.065 ± 0.004 mg/mL) is 5-fold higher than IC 50 value of NDGA (0.013 ± 0.003 mg/mL).
